en.levelText1: Earth is composed of four distinct layers. They are, the inner core, the outer core, the mantle and the crust.
en.levelText2: Pangea, also spelled Pangaea, in early geologic time, a supercontinent that incorporated almost all the landmasses on Earth.
en.levelText3: The theory of plate tectonics explains how the continents have moved apart from one initial continental mass called Pangea.
en.levelText5: There are three kinds of plate tectonic boundaries: divergent, convergent, and transform plate boundaries.
en.levelText6: Seafloor spreading involves the formation of new ocean rock at a mid-ocean ridge that pushes older ocean rock away towards deep sea trenches.
en.levelText7: Folding, faulting, and breaking are geologic processes due to tectonic plate movement that cause physical changes in rocks.
en.levelText9: A mid-ocean ridge is a divergent plate boundary where new ocean crust are formed through volcanic eruptions.
en.exp_0: The Earthâ€™s lithosphere, which includes the crust and upper mantle, is made up of a series of pieces, or tectonic plates, that move slowly over time.
en.exp_1: The major tectonic plates are the Eurasian, African, Indo-Australian, Pacific, North American, and South American plates.
en.exp_2: About 300 million years ago, Earth didn't have seven continents, but instead one massive supercontinent called Pangaea.
en.exp1_0: Transform plate boundaries slide relative to one another. Convergent plate boundaries move towards each other. Divergent plate boundaries move away from each other.
en.exp1_1: A mid-ocean ridge is a seafloor mountain system formed by plate tectonics. Ocean Trenches are where old ocean crust from one tectonic plate is pushed
en.exp1_2: Fold mountains are created where two or more of Earth's tectonic plates are pushed together. A fault is a fracture or zone of fractures between two blocks of rock.
en.exp2_0: As the plates separate, molten rock rises to the seafloor, producing enormous volcanic eruptions of basalt.
en.exp2_1: The earths inner and outer core are extremely hot. The mantle is hot, soft and solid rock. The crust contains rock, soil and sediments.
en.exp2_2: The earths inner and outer core are extremely hot. The mantle is hot, soft and solid rock. The crust contains rock, soil and sediments.

en.explain_0: Plate tectonics is a geological science that studies the movements and nature of the earth's crust.
en.explain_1: Subduction occurs at a deep sea trench where two tectonic plates converge, forcing oceanic rock to sink into Earths mantle.
en.explain_2: Continental drift describes one of the earliest ways geologists thought continents moved over time.
en.explain_3: Earthquakes typically occur at transform and convergent tectonic plate boundaries.
